qas.question: When did the First World War begin?
When WW1 began, Britain took the opportunity to take over most of which country's colonies?
Who took over German New Guinea?
The Sykes–Picot Agreement was signed in what year?

context: Britain's fears of war with Germany were realised in <a0_0>1914<a0_0/> with the outbreak of the First World War. Britain quickly invaded and occupied most of <a1_0>Germany<a1_0/>'s overseas colonies in Africa. In the Pacific, <a2_0>Australia<a2_0/> and New Zealand occupied German New Guinea and Samoa respectively. Plans for a post-war division of the Ottoman Empire, which had joined the war on Germany's side, were secretly drawn up by Britain and France under the <a4_0>1916<a4_0/> <a3_0>Sykes–Picot Agreement<a3_0/>. This agreement was not divulged to the Sharif of Mecca, who the British had been encouraging to launch an Arab revolt against their Ottoman rulers, giving the impression that Britain was supporting the creation of an independent Arab state.
